citation.article-title: A study of small-colony, beta-haemolytic, Lancefield group C streptococci within the anginosus group: description of Streptococcus constellatus subsp. pharyngis subsp. nov., associated with the human throat and pharyngitis.

p.s: Description of Streptococcus constellatus Prevot 1924 emend. Holdman and Moore 1974, emend. Whiley and Beighton 1991

The description of Streptococcus constellatus is the same as that given by Whiley & Beighton (1991) except that it is amended to include some strains producing β-N-acetylgalactosaminidase, β-N-acetylglucosaminidase, β-fucosidase, β-galactosidase and β-glucosidase. S. constellatus was described by Whiley & Beighton (1991) as including very few strains producing pgalactosidase or β-glucosidase and no strains able to produce β-N-acetylglucosaminidase or β-fucosidase. The proportion of strains producing β-N-acetylgalactosaminidase was not included in the previous description.
